headline: Easy Egg Noodles
description: An easy egg noodle recipe, just 5 ingredients! Homemade noodles are delicious in soups, or anytime you want an old-fashioned side to soak up gravy.

video.description: Freshly made egg noodles jazz up all your favorite pasta dishes.
video.name: Egg Noodles

name: Easy Egg Noodles

recipeInstructions.text: Stir flour and salt together in a large bowl. Add eggs, milk, and butter.
Knead dough until smooth, about 5 minutes. Let rest in a covered bowl for 10 minutes.
On a floured surface, roll dough out to a thickness of 1/8 to 1/4 inch. Cut into desired lengths and shapes.
Allow to air-dry before cooking, 10 to 15 minutes.
Cook noodles in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente, about 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Made a beautiful soft dough! I used my kitchenaid to mix then used the hook five minutes. Let rest then cut with my noodle cutter that I dearly love!
i love that unlike youtube you get a how to list of needed items and the shortest times , on youtube you get chaos ! i love allrecipes.
Love this recipe. I've used it several times.
Made some of the best food I've ever had

I stumbled across this recipe about 8 years ago and I’ve been using it ever since. I do find I have to let the dough rest for about 2 hours so it rolls out easy. I also add pepper into my mixture to give a little more flavor. It’s really a fool proof recipe. If it is too sticky, simply add a little flour at a time until you get the consistency you want and no stick.

My mother's family is from Germany and Ukraine, and we grew up eating these noodles for every family event. Fast forward 60 years and I'm teaching children in Guatemala how to make them. I like these especially since they don't turn to mush when cooked for a period of time -- like several hours -- and I can add flavors to them. Tonight they are cooked with roasted pork and have black pepper added. I like them with additional herbs in them as well. They are easy to make and take no time to cook. I don't ever roll them out. In our family they are cut into almost oblong strips on the palm of the hand directly into the water. I prefer mine very narrow, but bigger ones are incredible fried with bacon.
Wonderful recipe!! Made them with my dough hook and cut with pizza cutter! Easy and perfect!!
Dough was too moist to manage. Couldn't hold form. Tried adding a lot more flour, dough remained too soft to work.

this is a great, easy to work with pasta recipe. My one suggestion is to roll to 5 or 6 on the kitchenaid pasta attachment and cut them with a knife. If your pasta is well floured (or use corn starch), allow it to fold onto itself so that the entire length occupies ~3-4". Cut with a knife... dry and break up by hand... gives a great "home made noodle" look!

Great tasting noodles. My Mom has used this recipe for years. To save time though, I suggest rolling the noodles out into desired thickness, and then rolling the dough into a log. Then starting at the end, slice the noodles into desired width. Afterwards, just toss them around until they are all uncurled into noodles. Will save you a ton of time from just slicing them while lying flat. Also keeps them more uniform in shape.

My go to noodle recipe! Quick and simple. I do not hand roll my dough however, I use a kitchen aid . After the 10 minute rest, I cut my dough ball into 4 pieces and run the dough through the roller until I get to the 4 thickness. I use the Alfredo noodle attachment to cut the noodles. I usually get sheets roughly 2 feet long. I cut the noodles at desired length with kitchen scissors(knives make the noodles clump). One recipe usually yields me enough for 2 uses, one for now and one to freeze.

It was super simple, and quick, to prepare. The dough was a dream to work with, even though I had to use a soda can as a rolling pin, as we are mid move, and mine is still in a box in storage. Cut them with a pizza cutter.
Turned out too dry. Had to double the eggs and milk. That worked much better.
Excellent! We make this every year after thanksgiving. We use the left over bones and meat of the turkey to make a base for the noodles.

This was my first time making noodles and they turned out great! I made them about 4" by 0.5". Next time, I think I'll make them 2 or 3" long - they were a bit hefty for my chicken noodle soup. I dried them out for a few minutes in the oven at 175F. I just put them on a cookie sheet and they stuck a tiny bit. Next time, I'll probably use parchment paper or some other barrier. This recipe made a LOT of noodles. I put over half in my freezer for my next batch of soup :)

Because of the high reviews, I decided to try the recipe. My wife and I both agree. These are the worst egg noodles I have ever made. We pulled all the noodles from the chicken soup and made new ones with our own recipe.
Incredibly easy classic egg noodles. I threw everything in my bread machine & used the pizza dough setting (50 mins). Easy dough to handle and roll out.

I don't know if it was something I did but my noodles were chewy. I think a bit more footnotes on what to look out for or not to do would be appreciated. Although chewy, I really enjoyed my noodles and will definitely do them again.

Very good. Thanks to those suggesting using the Kitchen Aid with dough hook. Next time I make them I will use the suggestion of the bread machine. I made these noodles as I had milk I wanted to use up. Used the noodles in home made chicken soup I brought to sick friend. The rest of noodles I will put in freezer. These roll out very well.

Doing intermittent g fasting for health and cannot eat till 10am…, I’ve got and hour and a half before digging in. 

Halved the recipe…., because I’m home alone. Took maybe five minutes to get the noodles made and another 10 minutes to finish them and the beef cubes I barded and fried to add. Stirred it all together with some grated Parmesan cheese while my mouth watered and now I wait. ??
I'm really big into making as much stuff as I can from scratch. This recipe is easy to follow and the noodles taste great. Thanks for sharing this recipe!!!

I've made this recipe twice now. The first time I made no alterations and they turned out great, but didn't roll thin enough so they were more like fat dumplings. The second time I added a third egg and an extra half cup of flour. was able to roll it thinner by breaking it into three separate balls thanks to someone else's feedback. I just throw the noodles into the pot with my chicken soup fixings and minutes later serve up a divine favorite.
These were the easiest and fastest noodles I've ever made.
This recipe was amazing top it with a dash of parmesan and pesto and your good to go.
I used this recipe for chicken and noodles. My 82 year old mother told me she could not do better, as good as her mother made.
This recipe was a noodle first for me. I followed it to a T and couldn’t be happier with how they turned out...taste, texture, all perfection. I’d give it 10 stars if I could.

I had lost my original recipe and couldn't for the life of me remember some of the ingredients. I am so glad that I found this recipe, since it is so close to what I would make. The only change I made was to replace the butter with olive oil.

I tried this exact recipe in my new pasta maker and it failed. Next time I will ratio the flour with the liquid according to pasta maker's directions. Rolled the dough manually and boiled in salty water. They were delicious.
Made them just as they are, turned out perfect!
I couldn't find my roller so they were a little too thick.
Great!

Made the recipe exactly like it said and they were delicious! I’m not good at cutting them straight but the family didn’t mind! I made them early in the day and then let them dry while cooking thanksgiving dinner. I cooked them last in the broth from the turkey and they turned out perfect!
so very easy to make. they are drying now. I used to make these years aga when my kids were little. Now i am making them with the grand kids. Cant wait to eat them. Yummy!
I had never made noodles before, and these were ultra easy. I used them in Chinese Chicken Noodle Soup and they were a HIT!
Great recipe! Noodles are now drying for dinner tonight. Made them thick and wide, like I like them.
Very good
Fricking amazing! I loved them! Thanks
its simple and easy to follow. no need to run to the shop to buy pasta anymore.
Just like my grandmother's. Perfect amount of dough for a pot full of fettuccine too!
made a chowmein ! I don't have a pasta maker to cut my noodles but the texture is really good!
Took closer to 3C flour to make a workable dough. Noodles were good.
I think it was undercooked. But otherwise good
Me and my family loved it and we served it with salad too. (With moms balsamic vinaigrette) in allrecipes
Great noodles but they didn’t cook in the middle but that may have been me cutting them too thick

I made homemade noodles for my first time ever using this recipe. I followed the recipe exactly. It was very simple! I boiled them for about 3 to 4 minutes, which was perfect for my thick and non-uniform noodles. They were delicious in the homemade mushroom bolognese I made to toss them in. This is now a go-to recipe for me!
I made them exactly as the recipe called for only I let them dry overnight. They're perfect!

I read reviews good and bad before I made these egg noodles I rolled out my egg noodles to 1/8 thick cut my egg noodles about 1/8 wide I suggest rolling and cutting them as thin as you can with pizza cutter. plus I boiled them in water for about 3 mins before putting them in my soup just to get off the extra flour on the surface of the noodles . noodle are very heavy and chewy if you follow the cooking time directions I cooked mine a little longer in broth for my chicken noodle soup and it turned out perfect.
I would make this again but I had to add a little olive oil.
Simple and delicious.
Delicious and easy to make! Thank you !!
Not sure what went wrong but two batches turned out super dry and hard to work with!!
This recipe was very easy to follow and made a perfect meal for my family. It is also very filling and putting it with homemade alfredo sauce compliments the pasta perfect.
Tender noodle!
Great egg noodles like grandma used to make. simple and delicious

Light and fluffy, tasted good. The dough was really wet so I had to add a lot more flour. The humidity was high when I made them, so I will try again on a dryer day to see if that was the culprit. Thank you
Came out great. Tasted very much like my parents used to make. Brought back many memories.
Easy to make and turned out great!
It ruined my soup
I made these egg noodles tonight with beef stroganoff

First time I ever made egg noodles. Can't believe how easy it was. If I can offer one suggestion, roll these very very thin and cut in narrow strips. Mine puffed up on me as they cooked and ended up a bit thicker than I like, but the family loved them. They were delicious.
The BEST egg noodles ever!!
These are wonderful and easy to make!
Used for Thanksgiving and made with turkey drippings and broth. Yummy, easy and absolutely no clumping. Definitely roll them to 1/8 inch and for faster drying, cut them thin.

Love this recipe! This is the same recipe my mom taught me when I was little! I use a plastic pizza cutter when I'm cutting the noodles; I find it much easier! Also, it's so easy to "spice it up" for other dishes like adding italian seasoning, etc, for chicken alfredo. 
I normally let my noodles dry, but if I'm in a hurry, I've cooked them right after cutting.

These can be made any thickness you want....I did it like my mother and the National Cookbook of 1856 advises...Roll out dough paper thin, roll up tightly like a jelly roll and cut paper thin...
Mother never put butter or milk in them, it was at least a dozen of egg yolks, no whites ...Hers were rich, but these were just fine without all the yolks
Good basic recipe, just wish it told you how long to dry the noodles for. I admit that the environment does affect drying times but an approximation would be helpful.
I did a suggested 2 cups sugar 1/2 stick butter 3 tablespoons cocoa and 1 cup butter and they turned out perfect.
A favourite around here!! We toss these in burnt butter sauce and it’s addictive!
Come out amazing every time!

Really good noodles. I like mine much thinner, so I use a apsta roller machine to roll them to 1/16th inch and then use the fetuccini attachment to cut perfect noodles.
They still swell up, so don't worry about them being too thin. If you only roll the dough to 1/4 inch thickness, they will be a half inch thick when they cook, and that's just a nasty globby wreck. My method makes really nice thick egg noodles that aren't grossly thick. I also had seasonings to my flour before rolling. Sage, rosemary, black pepper. You can use lemon pepper, turmeric, spinach powder...anything at all :)
Make it about once a month , real good food .
Loved it.

What a gooey mess! My noodles turned to mush when I set them to the side to air dry. They all stuck together. I tried to salvage some with no luck. I tried again from the start,but then they all clumped together into one big ball in the pot. I think I give up.:(
I made this using flaxseed instead of eggs and it turned out AMAZING!
Good
Fantastic noodles, great texture
Used them in chicken soup made just like recipe
Easy , made in food processor for drying rack a wood stick hanging between 2 plastic pitchers
I made it and love it.

Hubby got me pasta roller and cutter attachments for my Kitchen Aid for Mother's Day. Already had steak soup in the Crock Pot, so I made my Very First Pasta Ever. I cooked half directly in the crock pot (rolled to a 2, fettucini cut) and I froze the rest. Next time I will let the pasta sit a bit longer before portioning so it can fully hydrate. Per another reviewer, I added black pepper to the pasta as well as salt since it was going into strongly flavored soup. Kids both asked for seconds. Husband is extremely happy with the results, and I am ecstatic. This will be a go-to recipe. Almost foolproof!
no,no changes.Yes over and over

Followed the recipe exactly and each time I make these my family wants more. I roll them thin and slice with a pizza cutter into strips and then pieces. I usually mix them with sauerkraut, and serve with pork chops or smoked sausage.
YUMMY
Perfect noodles!

i should have known, this recipe was a hoax when it said roll it out 1/8 to 1/4 thick, i used 8 egg yolks to form a dough, let it rest for 30 min. then rolled it out it was impossible to roll t out thinner doing so made the dough to fall a part. After cooking tasted like dough, not egg noodles
This is my go to recipe for noodles in my chicken noodle soup. My family loves them.
Delicious recipe! Definitely make again!
Super easy and quick!!!

These were great. I added them to a Turkey Noodle Soup. The family loved them. The only thing I did different was add a teaspoon of garlic powder when I added the salt. Another reviewer talked about rolling the dough and cutting the rolls. This was easy but took some time to unravel. Next time I might try using a pizza cutter instead. My son was shocked that I made the noodles from scratch. My sister in-law said it made the soup and took it up a notch.
I’ve made homemade noodles for years, but my recipe didn’t have butter. Made all the difference! Tender, tasty noodles. My new go to recipe. Thanks Linda!
This was easy, quick and a nice dough to work with. Rolling of the noodles excellent tip for a quick cut evenly.
I made just as the recipe said and they were great with chicken soup, which made the soup extra special.
Dough stiff. Couldn’t roll it.

Reminiscent of my mom’s hand made egg noodles growing up in the Midwest I decided to try this recipe. I hand cut them and rolled them so they were thicker and they took quite a long time to cook in the turkey broth. I did a second batch using my pasta machine and they were much thinner in a fettuccine cut. I added those to broth and they cooked within the time on this recipe. I think the other trick is drying time. Drying for a couple of hours and then placing them in a Ziploc bag in the fridge will cook them faster then if you allowed them to dry overnight. The overnight drying of the hand cut created more of a dumpling texture rather than a soft noodle texture. Perfect for freezing so spend a Saturday morning having a noodle fest and you’ll enjoy the fruits of your labor for the winter months.

This was a hit with my cooks !!! I made it in my restaurant as a staff meal (to put in a tasty soup ! ) and the cooks all loved the noodles, they asked me to make more of them next time so it was more noodle to soup ratio !! A++++

This recipe is very easy to follow, and you should definitely follow the recipe to the detail. Personally, I didn't let any of the noodles dry, which is recommended for egg noodles. Because of this, my noodles became extra wide, almost tripling in size versus doubling. I do recommend these noodles for a newbie
Perfect pasta. Easy and delicious

Just what I was looking for...
Easy to work with. Good texture and a nice al dente firmness.
Works very nicely with my dough hook and pasta roller.
Substituted garlic infused olive oil for butter with delightful results.
Love these noodles so easy and delicious I have gave this recipe to a few good friends and love them
